1. The Brown Derby - This iconic restaurant was a frequent haunt of Hollywood celebrities in the early 20th century. It was also featured in many movies, including "Sunset Boulevard."

2. Musso & Frank Grill - This restaurant has been a Hollywood institution since 1919 and has had many famous patrons, including Charlie Chaplin and Marilyn Monroe. It has also been featured in movies such as "Ed Wood."

3. The Rainbow Bar and Grill - This rock and roll-themed restaurant was a favorite of musicians such as Jim Morrison and John Lennon, as well as Hollywood stars like Humphrey Bogart and Elizabeth Taylor.

4. Yamashiro Hollywood - This Japanese-inspired restaurant and garden sits atop a hill overlooking Hollywood and has been featured in many movies, including "Memoirs of a Geisha" and "Kill Bill."

5. The Polo Lounge - Located in the iconic Beverly Hills Hotel, the Polo Lounge has been the go-to spot for Hollywood's elite since the 1940s. It has hosted many celebrities and even served as the setting for scenes in movies like "The Graduate" and "Beverly Hills Cop."
